description: Use the chrome.sidebar API to interact with the browser's sidebar system. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange sidebars in the browser.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hides sidebar's mini tab for the specified tab and collapses sidebar if it was in 'active' state (see getState). Has no effect if the sidebar is already hidden.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows sidebar mini tab (in 'shown' state) for the specified tab. Has no effect if already expanded, otherwise changes status to 'shown'.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

width.description: The width in pixels for the sidebar display area. If not specified, the sidebar will be sized to fit its contents. current window.

sidebar.description: URL to which to navigate the sidebar.

functions.name: getState
functions.description: Returns current sidebar state for the specified tab.

tabId.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

shown.description: 'shown' indicates that a sidebar is defined displayed for the specified tab.

pinned.description: 'pinned' indicates the pin button is depressed.
